oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Road and construction improvements on Church Street and Fifth Avenue North looking east, Nashville, Tennessee, between 1976 and 1977
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photographs showing the road and construction improvements along Church Street and Fifth Avenue N looking east, Nashville, Tennessee, between the dates of 1976 and 1977. Several businesses and organizations in the central business district are depicted: The Downtown Presbyterian Church; United American Bank; Crescent Theater; J.C. Bradford; Petway Reavis Company; Ray Reed Beauty Salon; Third National Bank; Cokesbury Books; Card-N-Book Store; Baker’s Shoe Store; Shyer Jewelry Store; Flagg Brothers; and the W.T. Grant Department Store. Forms part of the Metro Archives Photographs - Streets Collection. 32 b & w photographs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Downtown Presbyterian Church (Nashville, Tenn.); United American Bank of Nashville; Crescent Theater (Nashville, Tenn.); J.C. Bradford & Co. (Nashville, Tenn.); Petway Reavis Company (Nashville, Tenn.); Ray Reed Beauty Salon (Nashville, Tenn.); Third National Bank (Nashville, Tenn.); Cokesbury Books (Nashville, Tenn.); Card-N-Book Store (Nashville, Tenn.); Baker’s Shoe Store (Nashville, Tenn.); Shyer Jewelry Store (Nashville, Tenn.); Flagg Brothers (Nashville, Tenn.); W.T. Grant Department Store (Nashville, Tenn.)
